script:
SetShortcut exerelinNGCIntroNextPage RETURN
SetShortcut exerelinNGCIntroEnd ESCAPE
text:
Welcome to the Nexerelin mod for Starsector!

Nexerelin is essentially a 4X game set in a corner of the Starsector universe. Factions within the sector will wage war, create alliances and compete to control a greater share of the sector.

Nexerelin is compatible with a large number of community-made faction mods, which you can add for a more varied gameplay experience.

script:
SetShortcut exerelinNGCIntroNextPage RETURN
SetShortcut exerelinNGCIntroEnd ESCAPE
text:
Your actions will gain or lose you influence with the factions in the Sector. The higher your influence with a faction, the greater access to their support and technology you will have.

At the start of the game, you pick a faction to join. You are a representative of your chosen faction, and your actions in the Sector will reflect on them. 

You can move to another faction later, if you can earn their trust. You can also choose to go it alone and set up your own empire.
Have fun and please leave any feedback on the Starsector forums :)
Configure the Sector?
notes: make sure this runs once per new game, so that Exerelin sector generation data is set up properly

$menuState = invasion 0
ShowVisual "graphics/illustrations/quartermaster.jpg"
PredictInvasionResults false
Nex_PrepareResponseFleet false
FireAll ExerelinInvadeListOptions
text: Your intelligence officer runs a few quick simulations to predict the outcome of the attack.

script:
SetEnabled exerelinInvasionProceed true
SetShortcut exerelinInvasionProceed RETURN

SetTooltip exerelinInvasionProceed "You have no marines!"
SetEnabled exerelinInvasionProceed false
Nex_AddOptionConfirmation exerelinInvasionProceed "$TheFaction is not currently hostile. Are you sure you wish to invade $market?" "Yes" "No"

text:
Base attacker strength = (marine strength + fleet points/2) * 0.7
Base defender strength = 0.2 * (market size+1)^3 * (stability + 0.5) * 0.5
Each Military Base and Regional Capital adds 25% to defender strength, Headquarters adds 40%.
Attacker strength varies by up to 1/7th in either direction.

If attacker roll exceeds defender strength, the market is captured.
Marine losses depend on both strength values, plus a random factor.

Markets accumulate a reserve force over time that can be quickly deployed in response to invasions.

script:
Wait $global.exerelinInvasionWait 1 $global.exerelinInvasionRoundComplete $global.exerelinInvasionInterrupted $global.exerelinInvasionInProgress "Invading..."
Exerelin_NotifyInvasion $global.exerelinInvasionWait 750 false
MakePlayerImmediatelyAttackable
$player.invasionTarget = $id 1.01
CreateWarmongerEvent $faction.id
AdjustRep $faction.id COMBAT_NORMAL

text: As your $shipOrFleet moves in closer, the response fleet scrambles from $market. The only way is through them.

script:
$menuState = invasion 0
ShowVisual "graphics/illustrations/quartermaster.jpg"
SetPromptText "You decide to..."

text: Your $shipOrFleet neutralizes the response fleet and is ready to invade $market.
INVASION OUTCOME:

MakeOtherFleetHostile true

"You'll pay for trying to invade our territory!" The comm link is cut before you can begin to respond.

script:
SetShortcut exerelinRaid R
SetEnabled exerelinRaid true

SetTooltip exerelinRaid "You've recently raided this market and cannot do so again for $nex_raidCooldownStr days."

$menuState = raid 0
ShowVisual "graphics/illustrations/pirate_station.jpg"
PredictInvasionResults true
FireAll ExerelinRaidListOptions
text: Your intelligence officer runs a few quick simulations to predict the outcome of the attack.

script:
SetEnabled exerelinRaidProceed true
SetShortcut exerelinRaidProceed RETURN

SetTooltip exerelinRaidProceed "You have no marines!"
SetEnabled exerelinRaidProceed false

SetTooltip exerelinRaidProceed "A nearby hostile fleet is tracking your movements, making, a raid impossible."
SetEnabled exerelinRaidProceed false
text: A nearby hostile fleet is tracking your movements, making a raid impossible.

script: Nex_AddOptionConfirmation exerelinRaidProceed "$TheFaction is not currently hostile, and you have been positively identified. Are you sure you wish to raid $market?" "Yes" "No"

text:
Base attacker strength = (marine strength + fleet points/2) * 0.7
Base defender strength = 0.2 * (market size+1)^3 * (stability + 0.5) * 0.375
Each Military Base and Regional Capital adds 25% to defender strength, Headquarters adds 40%.
Attacker strength varies by up to 1/7th in either direction.

Amount of loot is determined by ratio of attacker strength to defender strength (must be >1 to get anything).
Marine losses depend on both strength values, plus a random factor.
RAID OUTCOME:
As your $shipOrFleet moves in closer, a defence fleet scrambles from $market. It's clear they won't let you go further without a fight.

script:
$menuState = raid 0
ShowVisual "graphics/illustrations/pirate_station.jpg"

script:

SetTooltipHighlights exerelinFleetRequestFire $fleetRequestCost $player.creditsHave
Nex_AddOptionConfirmation exerelinFleetRequestFire "$TheFaction is not currently hostile, and you have configured the fleet request as an invasion fleet. Do you want to proceed?" "Yes" "No"

SetEnabled exerelinSuperweapon false

$menuState = superweapon 0
Exerelin_ShowShipVisual $bestSuperweapon
Nex_PrepareResponseFleet true
SetShortcut exerelinSuperweaponProceed RETURN
SetShortcut exerelinSuperweaponCancel ESCAPE
Nex_AddOptionConfirmation exerelinSuperweaponProceed "Confirm superweapon use?" "Fire" "Abort"
text:
You can use a superweapon on $market to cause massive devastation, clearing the way for an invasion. Expect the enemy to try to stop you.

Be warned of the political repercussions.

script:
CreateWarmongerEvent $faction.id
AdjustRep $faction.id COMBAT_AGGRESSIVE
Exerelin_UseSuperweapon
FireBest ExerelinSuperweaponDialog

text: As your $shipOrFleet moves in closer, a defence fleet scrambles from $market. You'll need to fight your way through them to deploy your superweapon.

script:
$menuState = superweapon 0
Exerelin_ShowShipVisual $bestSuperweapon
SetPromptText "You decide to..."
SetShortcut exerelinSuperweaponProceed RETURN
SetShortcut exerelinSuperweaponCancel ESCAPE
Nex_AddOptionConfirmation exerelinSuperweaponProceed "Confirm superweapon use?" "Fire" "Abort"
text: Your $shipOrFleet neutralizes the defence fleet and is ready to deploy your superweapon.

The missile hits a shield several hundred meters short of the ground and detonates in a brilliant flash. When it clears, the rocky ground beneath is visibly scorched, but no real damage has been inflicted.

In hindsight, trying to bomb a hardened underground installation protected by Templar technology probably wasn't the best idea.
Superweapon deployment failed!
Your $shipOrFleet approaches the asteroid.

text: Contact with the other fleet suspends mining operations.
Your $shipOrFleet has completed mining on $entityName.

After a short wait, your connection request is accepted.

"This is $rank $local.name, $post. State your business."

After a short wait, your connection request is accepted.

"This is $rank $local.name, $post of $entityName. Speak quickly or be purged."

After a short wait, your connection request is accepted.

"Yeah, what is it?"
"Hello, chief. What can we do for you?"
"Good to hear. We can always use more of these things. Standard bounty applies."
"Anything else?"

script:
SetTooltip exerelinJoinFaction "$TheFaction do not trust you enough yet."
SetEnabled exerelinJoinFaction false

SetTooltip exerelinJoinFaction "To join $theFaction you will leave $player.theFaction."

SetEnabled exerelinJoinFaction false

SetTooltip exerelinLeaveFaction "Knights Templar only leave the cause in death."
SetEnabled exerelinLeaveFaction false

SetTooltip nex_resignCommission "Knights Templar only leave the cause in death."
SetEnabled nex_resignCommission false

SetShortcut exerelinJoinFactionConfirm RETURN
SetShortcut exerelinBaseCommanderMenuRepeat ESCAPE
Exerelin_GetSalary
SetTextHighlights $salary "insurance"
text: "Good, good. We can offer you a place, with benefits including a monthly salary of $salary credits and insurance payments on ship loss. Just fill out this form here..."
"Alright, you're registered. Welcome to the team."

script:
SetShortcut exerelinJoinFactionConfirm RETURN
SetShortcut exerelinBaseCommanderMenuRepeat ESCAPE
Exerelin_GetSalary
SetTextHighlights $salary "insurance"
text: "Wanna be a freebooter, eh? Your cut of the community loot will be $salary credits per month, along with ship loss insurance. Here's some paperwork to fill out for the boss."
"Excellent! I'll let the boys know about you."

script:
SetShortcut exerelinJoinFactionConfirm RETURN
SetShortcut exerelinBaseCommanderMenuRepeat ESCAPE
SetTextHighlights $salary "insurance"
text: "So you wish to join our noble cause? You will receive a monthly stipend of $salary, among other benefits including ship loss insurance. Are you prepared to give your oath?"
"You are now one of us, $playerName. May our holy light purge the heathens!"

script:
SetShortcut exerelinLeaveFactionConfirm RETURN
SetShortcut exerelinBaseCommanderMenuRepeat ESCAPE
text: "I'm sorry to hear that. If you're sure you want to leave, fill out this form."
"Alright, you're free to go. Good luck out there."

script:
SetShortcut exerelinLeaveFactionConfirm RETURN
SetShortcut exerelinBaseCommanderMenuRepeat ESCAPE
text: "What, you're not seriously going legit, are you? Fine, fill out this here form."
"Alright. If you ever come to your senses, you know where to find us."

script:
SetShortcut exerelinResignCommissionConfirm RETURN
SetShortcut exerelinBaseCommanderMenuRepeat ESCAPE
text: "No longer interested, eh? Very well, fill out this form."
"Your commission is officially terminated. Have a good day."

options: nex_transferMarketMainWithDialog:Transfer this market to another faction

text: "You truly wish to give away $market? Very well, to whom?"

"As you command. $market is now in possession of $entity._newFaction.

"Goodbye, chief."

script:
SetTooltip nex_instigateRebellion "You currently do not have access to $market to insert the needed assets."
SetEnabled nex_instigateRebellion false

SetTooltip nex_instigateRebellion "A rebellion is already in progress on $market."
SetEnabled nex_instigateRebellion false

Nex_InstigateRebellion init
SetShortcut nex_instigateRebellionProceed RETURN
SetShortcut nex_hostileActionMenu ESCAPE
text: You can attempt to start a rebellion on $market. This will always succeed but will cost a significant amount of resources, and $theFaction will turn hostile if your actions are discovered.

options: nex_supplyCounterInsurgency:"I can help with your rebellion problem."

script:
SetTooltip nex_supplyCounterInsurgency "$TheFaction simply do not trust you to supply them."
SetEnabled nex_supplyCounterInsurgency false

AddText "Indeed? We could make good use of any supplies, hand weapons or marines you possess, purchased at market rates. And the gratitude of $theFaction, once the dust settles."
Nex_RebellionActions main
Nex_RebellionActions printPriceMult

text: "Anything else?"

script:
SetTooltip nex_getPricesMain "Your reputation with $theFaction is not good enough to use this service."
SetEnabled nex_getPricesMain false

id: #Must be after all other rules with that trigger

script:
AddText "\Don't screw around with your transponder in our space, damnit! Uh. Chief.\""
$sawPlayerWithTOffCount = 0

text:
Moments later, $PersonRank $personName reappears, looking vaguely flustered and embarrassed.

"Sorry, chief. Didn't recognize you with your transponder off. You can go, now."

"$playerName, $theFactionLong $factionIsOrAre not going to suffer you any longer."
OR
"Your time has come, $playerName."
OR
"$TheFactionLong sends their regards, $playerName."

Your $shipOrFleet approaches the museum ship.

script:
SetEnabled nex_museumVisit false 
SetTooltip nex_museumVisit "You are too embarrassingly impoverished to afford the entrance fee."

text: The visit proves to be quite educational. You pick up various bits of information that could prove useful in your travels.
Although you've been here before, the visit is nevertheless a relaxing, pleasant experience.

This autonomous warning beacon emits a looping message.

"DANGER: This planet's surface is contaminated with highly hazardous pathological agents. Quarantine is in effect as per Domain protocol MG1.17."

It is not known whether whatever agent prompted the quarantine is still present on the surface.

This autonomous beacon serves as a memorial marker, in remembrance of a battle between the $faction and $nex_memorialFaction2 forces. Its looping message contains a list of the $faction casualties, with the names of their family members and their places of origin. The $nex_memorialFaction2 dead are not listed.

script: AddText "Bright, slick, overusing chrome and opal ornaments, the concourse is quite the unusual sight for a station lost in hyperspace. Wherever the eye looks, every detail spells luxury. On the sides, behind extravagant transparent promenades, the source of all this wealth is offered to the observation of all potential buyers: the menacing and yet reassuring silhouettes of ships from all origins, all pristine looking and advantageously lit. A bit further it's the weapons that are exposed in the same fashion. Holo displays and simulators are available everywhere to help clients to find the perfect tool to fit their needs." textGrayColor

AddText "The port concourse is filled with trader starcraft of every size. Speculators crowd offloading ship captains with deals and peddlers call out to crew, holding wares and projecting personal ad-holos. Guards salute you in recognition as you pass by them." textGrayColor

text: Your $shipOrFleet approaches the battlestation. A thoroughly impressive piece of firepower, it will engage anyone foolish enough to attempt an invasion under its watch.
As your $shipOrFleet moves in closer, new energy signatures are detected near the $shortName.
As your $shipOrFleet moves in closer, new energy signatures are detected near a larger pieces of debris.
As your $shipOrFleet moves in closer, several energy signatures are detected coming online inside the probe's hold.
As your $shipOrFleet moves in closer, multiple energy signatures are detected coming online from various points on and within the flayed hull of the survey ship.

As your $shipOrFleet moves in closer, numerous strong energy signatures are detected coming online inside the darkened work-bays of the mothership's vast hulk. Your sensors also detect several weapon empacements powering up on the mothership itself.
As your $shipOrFleet moves in closer, numerous strong energy signatures are detected coming online inside the darkened work-bays of the mothership's vast hulk.
As your $shipOrFleet moves in closer, your sensors detect several weapon empacements powering up in darkened crevasses on the mothership's vast hulk.

script: AddText "The port concourse is dark and empty but for a few looted hulks. The atmosphere reads out as thin, but there is sufficient power from hardened passive collectors to run basic life support and storage functions." marketFlavorTextColor

text: You've got a comm sniffer running on this relay.

"I've already told you not to mess with $faction hardware. Maybe this'll reinforce the message."

The comm link is cut before you can begin to respond.

script:
$entity.ignorePlayerCommRequests = true 1
$entity.exerelinFleetAggressAgainstPlayer = true 1
unset $entity.respondingToCommRelayInterference
unset $entity.core_fleetBusy
MakeOtherFleetHostile sniffer true
ShowDefaultVisual
EndConversation
text: You cut the comm link without acknowledging $PersonRank $personName's words. As $hisOrHer $otherShipOrFleet maintains an aggressive posture, that may not have been the best means of obtaining a peaceful resolution.
However, instead of proceeding with the scan, the $faction $fleetName shuts down comms and powers up combat systems.

script:
AddText"\"I told you last time to keep your transponder on.\""
AdjustRep $faction.id TRANSPONDER_OFF
AdjustRepActivePerson TRANSPONDER_OFF
AddText "The comm link is cut before you have a chance to respond."
$entity.ignorePlayerCommRequests = true 0
$entity.exerelinFleetAggressAgainstPlayer = true 1
unset $entity.transponderOffConv

$entity.ignorePlayerCommRequests = true 0
$entity.exerelinFleetAggressAgainstPlayer = true 1
unset $entity.transponderOffConv
AdjustRep $faction.id TRANSPONDER_OFF_REFUSE
AdjustRepActivePerson TRANSPONDER_OFF_REFUSE
MakeHostileWhileTOff tOff true 7
ShowDefaultVisual
EndConversation

unset $ignorePlayerCommRequests
$cargoScanConv = true 0
$cargoScan_didAlready = true 0
$entity.smugglingScanComplete = true 1
unset $entity.pursuePlayer_smugglingScan
AddText "The $faction $otherShipOrFleet looks like it wants to scan you, but doesn't." $faction.baseColor
AddText "You're being hailed by the $faction $otherShipOrFleet." $faction.baseColor
OpenComms

text:
"We've received complaints of smuggling activity around these parts. Now I know there's no way you'd have anything to do with it, but discretion would be helpful. Appearances have to be maintained, you know."
OR
"Damn it, chief, could you try to be a little more subtle? We're under a lot of pressure to deal with the smuggling around here, and we don't need to attract attention where we'd rather not people start looking."

script:
$entity.ignorePlayerCommRequests = true 0
unset $entity.cargoScanConv
unset $entity.pursuePlayer_smugglingScan
$entity.smugglingScanComplete = true 1
$entity.exerelinFleetAggressAgainstPlayer = true 1
AdjustRep $faction.id CARGO_SCAN_REFUSE
AdjustRepActivePerson CARGO_SCAN_REFUSE
ShowDefaultVisual
EndConversation

text:
"Oh? That's something you're going to regret."

The comm link is cut before you have a chance to respond.

text: Your scanners pick up a massive energy signature manifesting on $entityName, followed by a high-power burst transmission from below: "Come no further, lest the light of judgment be called upon you to ascend thy soul, in flames, to the great star above."

script:
AddText "Posh olive-green pillows and scented candles greet you as you enter the grand lobby, a vast entry area for the myriad travellers who journey to Shanghai. A hundred-meter-tall holographic map of the station hovers overhead, illuminating the area in warm light. Ahead, a wide hallway leads to the primary trade center." textGrayColor
AddText "The hallway opens to a large, open bazaar. While the structure is clearly a large warehouse being used as a flea market, in truth it resembles a small city. Market stalls of every shape and size, trading venues, infotainment booths, concession stands, and even a brothel is littered throughout, creating a haphazard series of streets and alleys. Armed Tiandong agents patrol the makeshift roads, breaking up fights and helping the occasional lost quartermaster." textGrayColor
